5.50.text:
I now live here in Batlow in the
western side of the snowy mountains.

10.75.text: My husband, Ian, and I run Cascades Nursery.

14.94.text: We have around 300 varieties of trees.

18.35.text:
So, there is a tree size, shape,
color to suit every garden.

24.54.text:
Deciduous ornamental
trees, you can buy them 2,

27.78.text:
3, 4 meters tall so they're
like a ready garden for you.

31.17.text:
In our nursery here we have a
propagation shed where we have the

35.61.text:
cuttings and the seeds and
all the young plants.

37.86.text:
When they're old enough to
come out into the weather,

40.87.text:
we bring them out for at least a
year so they-- into the weather,

45.45.text: the frosts, and the winds, and the heavy sun.

48.33.text:
Once they've been there for a year,
then we move them over to the other

51.59.text: side of our nursery where they are for sale.

54.35.text:
We have customers come along to the
nursery and that's nice because

57.90.text:
then they can see everything
that we have in stock.

60.26.text:
People who are just starting
off with a bare block of land,

63.64.text: we can show them our gardens.

65.61.text:
From that they can get ideas of
what sort of thing they want to put

69.58.text: That's why we have display gardens here.

73.26.text: I love being out in the weather.

74.66.text: I love the sun on me.

76.23.text:
I doesn't matter if it's
raining, that's okay too.

78.61.text:
If you wanted to start a career in
a nursery I would actually work

82.38.text: in a nursery, and probably not just one.

84.28.text:
I'd try a few different nurseries
that do different things.

90.24.text:
Some might be wholesalers
doing rooted cuttings.

93.10.text:
There are so many different aspects
to this particular industry.

96.14.text:
Try different things and see
which one interests you.
